Hi Nicole and Luke are you ready for...

DAY 1 - Cairns Diving Great Barrier Reef

DAY 2 - Cairns Lagoon and Bar Crawl

DAY 3 - Cairns White water rafting

DAY 4 - Cairns Bungy Jumping

DAY 5 - Cairns Kuranda Scenic Railway

27/12/2020

Travel Tips

Top Apps to download to make your travels stress free.

You can navigate Australia using these apps:

TripGo- Great for displaying the train platforms etc when changing trains and up to date bus routes you can track the current location of the next bus.

Waze- Useful if you are driving as it highlights Toll routes and also speed cameras and up to date traffic alerts.

Uber- Cheap rides around the City.

Download the below apps for great deals for food and drinks:

Eat Club- regularly updated discounts, you can use the map to find up to 50% discounts near you. You just need to book a table using the app and show the code on arrival. (You can book last minute)

The Happiest Hour- Shows nearby happy hour deals as well as food discounts.

For accommodation options download the below apps:

Booking.com- All types of hotels can be found on booking.com, they often offer free cancellation so this will help you plan ahead but still gives you flexibility.

HostelWorld- Great for booking last minute hostels and they are rated based on a young audiences experience.

WikiCamps- Shows all the available camp grounds in Australia, it is also available offline which means its accessible when exploring a little further off the grid.

Additional Apps that we recommend:

Beach safe- An app that tells you if the beach is safe to swim and where to find the flags that are safe to swim between. This is very important in Australia as the tide can be extremely strong and there are also potentially dangerous saline in unsupervised waters.

XE Currency Converter- The most up to date way to check the conversion rate which will help you manage your spending.

Nature Near Me- Great for finding local hikes and seeing what amenities that are available at each spot as well as total distance and pictures on the route.

WikiCamps- Shows all the available camp grounds in Australia, it is also available offline which means its accessible when exploring a little further off the grid.

Introduction to: Cairns

Intro to Cairns

Cairns is located in far North Queensland and is right at the heart of the Great Barrier Reef. Cairns is known for activities such as diving, white water rafting and bungy jumping, along with a great nightlife.

Cape Tribulation is a short day trip from Cairns and it is the only place in the world where the Reef meets the Rainforest.

Getting Around

Cairns has very limited transport options so you will need to book a taxi or an Uber from the airport.

Most tourist locations are within walking distance or may require using taxi services.

DAY 1 : Diving Great Barrier Reef

View Image

DAY 1

Location: Cairns

Activity: Diving Great Barrier Reef

Whether you have dived before or not, you’re on the Great Barrier Reef and you should definitely give it a go. You can book guided dives if your PADI certified or discovery dives if you have never dived before. A discovery dive will cost around $240 for a full day on the reef and you will be able to dive to 6metres and get a feel for life on the reef. Look out for turtles, stingers and possible even some reef sharks.

For those who are experienced divers you can also book full day tours on the reef for all different levels also at Cairns Diving .

DAY 2 : Explore the markets and Bar Crawl

View Image

DAY 2

Location: Cairns

Activity: Explore the markets and Bar Crawl

Spend the day at the Cairns Lagoon. Much like Airlie Beach and Brisbane, Cairns has a man-made Lagoon right by the ocean where you can relax all day before heading out on one of Cairn’s famous bar crawls.

Start the evening by heading to check out the Cairns night markets, they have some crazy bargains here as well as pamper sessions and massages.

After some browsing at the markets go to the Woolshed for dinner and some table dancing before slowly making your way through all the bars in town and finishing the night at Gilligans, Cairns best Hostel for nightlife.

DAY 3 : White water rafting

View Image

DAY 3

Location: Cairns

Activity: White water rafting

One of the most popular activities in Cairns is White Water Rafting. Book a half day tour with Foaming Fury and spend 2 full hours rafting along Barron river. You will be picked up from Cairns and driven 20 minutes to the Barron River where you will be given your equipment and taught some of the things you’ll need to know on the river. The Barron River has grade 3 rapids which is suitable for beginners. Prices start from $145.

If you like the sound of White water rafting but you’re on a tighter budget you could book a river tubing trip on the Mulgrave river for $90. Again you will be picked up from Cairns and dropped back again. This experience will be roughly 4 and a half hours.

You will need to take a towel, a change of clothes, suncream and some water.

You’ve worked up an appetite so treat yourself to a nice dinner at the Salt House which offers one of the best seats in town. Right on the marina, they serve lunch and dinner and you can choose from the Bar, restaurant or pizzeria. This is the go-to for locals as it’s such a great location.

DAY 4 : Bungy Jump and Jungle Swing

View Image

DAY 4

Location: Cairns

Activity: Bungy Jump and Jungle Swing

Cairns is a bit of an adventure hot spot and is home to an AJ Hackett skypark. You can choose from Bungy jumping or the giant jungle swing, or of course do both! The bungy jump is 50m high and it’s the only place you can bungy in Australia. Choose form 16 different ways to jump from Cairns only viewing platform with a view of the Northern Beaches. Bungy jump prices start from $179.

If you’ve bungy jumped before and you’re looking to do something different you can instead test out the Giant Jungle swing that drops from 45m with a self release pully to set you flying at speeds reaching 120km and hour. Prices for the swing start from $129 and include free transport from your accommodation.

If you’re really feeling adventurous you can do both for a bundle price of $269.

Once you’ve finished being a daredevil you’re going to need something to celebrate so head to Flamingo’s Tiki Bar for some cocktails and a great atmosphere to keep your buzz going.

DAY 5 : Kuranda Scenic Railway

View Image

DAY 5

Location: Cairns

Activity: Kuranda Scenic Railway

Kuranda Scenic Railway is a popular day trip in to the Rainforest. You can book a round trip on the Kuranda Railway or alternatively you can opt for the Skyrail gondola one way so you get to experience both. Once you arrive in Kuranda you can visit the brightly coloured village markets, Rainforest Nature Park or the Kuranda Koala Gardens. It’s recommended that you allow 2-3hours in Kuranda before taking the scenic journey back to Cairns.

The railway and the skyrail each take an hour and a half, you can choose which route you take there and back and you can also book pick up and return transfers from your Cairns accommodation from a total of $130.
